newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Settler shoots at Arab homes in Hebron - witnesses.
newsitem.headline: Settler shoots at Arab homes in Hebron - witnesses.

text.p: A Jewish settler fired shots at Arab houses in the West Bank town of Hebron on Sunday but caused no casualties, Palestinian witnesses said.
Israel Radio said two settlers shot in the air after Palestinians stoned their car from rooftops near the Tomb of the Patriarchs.
Witnesses said soldiers detained one settler and took his gun away.

Some 400 settlers live in Hebron, home to 100,000 Palestinians and a flashpoint of Arab-Israeli violence. Israel and the PLO are currently negotiating the implementation of a long-delayed Israeli troop redeployment from the town.
In 1994, Baruch Goldstein, a Jewish settler from nearby Kiryat Arba, massacred 29 Arab worshippers in a Hebron mosque.
Palestinians have complained frequently of mistreatment by Hebron settlers, who include some of the most militant Israelis living in the West Bank.
Settlers have said a partial Israeli army pullout from the town would put their lives in jeopardy.
